info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 8:51PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Jackson County through 915 PM PDT... At 850 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Emigrant Lake, or near Ashland, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, very heavy rain, and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain may cause ponding on roads. Locations impacted include... Interstate 5, Ashland, Talent, Mount Ashland Snow Park, and Emigrant Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
